document_data.name: Maurvurr
document_data.mainbody: The '''Maurvurr''' were a group of magic-using brigands that operated out of the eastern edge of the [[Forest of Amtar]] in [[southeast Faerûn]] ''circa'' the [[1372 DR|Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR]].{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|60}}{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 49: The Road to Khôltar, Part 2}}
document_data.Tactics: The Maurvurr were unusual because they were a band of predominately [[sorcerer]]s and [[wizard]]s, and were only interested in acquiring [[spellbook]]s, magic items, spell components, and substances that could be used in [[alchemy]]. They preyed on caravans and travelers on the [[Trader's Way]] north and west of [[Delzimmer]], using whatever magical Art that would increase their knowledge and arsenal without putting themselves at great risk.
document_data.Base of Operations: The Maurvurr lived in the fringe of the eastern [[Forest of Amtar]] close to the Trader's Way.
document_data.Members: The membership consisted of spellcasters of various races.
